meanings.definition: To arrange or direct the elements of (a situation) to produce a desired effect.
meanings.sent1: She orchestrated the surprise party for her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher orchestrated the classroom seating plan to encourage collaboration.
meanings.sent3: The cat orchestrated a clever plan to steal the fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The team captain orchestrated the perfect play that led to a winning goal.
meanings.sent5: The conductor meticulously orchestrated each note to create a beautiful symphony.
